companies.name: Oura
companies.description: Oura develops a smart ring wearable that provides continuous health monitoring including sleep tracking, activity, recovery scores, and heart rate variability metrics.
companies.similarity: Both offer screen-free, 24/7 wearables focused on recovery metrics, sleep analysis, and health optimization without traditional fitness watch displays

companies.name: Garmin
companies.description: Garmin manufactures GPS-enabled wearables and fitness devices with proprietary Body Battery and Sleep Coach features for athletes and fitness enthusiasts.
companies.similarity: Both target serious athletes with recovery metrics, strain tracking, and performance optimization features including proprietary algorithms for training readiness

companies.name: Polar
companies.description: Polar produces wearable fitness trackers and heart rate monitors with advanced training load and recovery insights for endurance athletes.
companies.similarity: Both focus on heart rate sensor accuracy, recovery tracking, and training optimization with band-style wearables marketed toward serious athletes

companies.name: Ultrahuman
companies.description: Ultrahuman creates smart rings and metabolic health devices that track sleep, recovery, and continuous glucose monitoring without subscription fees.
companies.similarity: Both provide continuous health monitoring, recovery insights, and detailed sleep analysis targeting health-conscious consumers and performance optimization

companies.name: Amazfit
companies.description: Amazfit develops affordable wearable fitness trackers including the Helio Ring and Helio Strap with recovery metrics and sleep tracking capabilities.
companies.similarity: Both offer band-style wearables with recovery tracking, strain monitoring, and continuous health metrics; Amazfit's Helio Strap is considered a direct WHOOP competitor
